review: Google has done a pretty good job here by creating a relatively inexpensive method for wirelessly sending videos and the web to your TV.  Syncing with your laptop is easy as long as you are willing to use Google Chrome as your browser.  If you don't like Chrome only use it when you want to sync and use your preferred browser all other times.  Now when using an iPhone, the only two apps that work with Chromecast right now are YouTube and Netflix, so there is not a lot of versatility here (is this really a surprise considering it is considerably cheaper than Apple TV?).  I have read that Android phones work a little better.  I use Chromecast mainly to watch Amazon Instant Video from my laptop, and with a few tweeks it works flawlessly.  I highly recommend this device especially if you are mainly going to use it as a way to view internet content on your TV.  I mean if you buy the Chromecast and are having trouble getting something to work, just Google it.  Somebody out there in cyberspace is sure to have figured it out.

review: An absolutely stellar little device.Pros :SIMPLE. I cannot stress this point enough. Plug it in, follow the brief instructions, and you're done.CHEAP. If i had to buy a new one every month (which is absurd) it would still be less than 1/4 my monthly cable bill.CONVENIENT. I can cast from any of my smart devices, from anywhere in reach of your WiFi connection.Cons:Windows Tablet RT OS does not support it.I have 2, one for each of my TVs and I turned off my cable service entirely in favor of an internet based entertainment situation. This device has already saved me hundreds of dollars in cable subscription bills and tons of heartache dealing with terrible cable service and hit-or-miss DVR performance.
